channel.title: Distros on Shreyas Mayya
channel.description: Recent content in Distros on Shreyas Mayya

item.title: Distro Updates - 7/5/2020
item.description: Well, I distrohopped again. Even better, I hopped back to where I was before the last time I hopped. On my laptop, I'm using openSUSE Tumbleweed. The more up-to-date Plasma in the official repos enticed me back. On my secondary PC/server, I'm using openSUSE Leap 15.2 for consistency, and also because I hadn't tried the recently-released 15.2 version.

item.title: Distro Updates
item.description: As if it wasn't already abundantly clear that I have too much time on my hands, I did some distrohopping today. What is distrohopping? For the uninitiated, distrohopping is the practice of jumping between Linux distributions (or "distros") because… well, because you can, I suppose. (I want to write a longer post about distrohopping, so keep an eye out for that!) Well, what did you switch to? Without further ado:
